revised_title: Investigation of Supersaturation and Nuclear Condensation of Organic Vapours
tldr: This study investigates the condensation of organic vapours when air is cooled by adiabatic expansion. The authors examine the effects of Rontgen rays on the air and vapour, and compare the efficiency of positive and negative ions as condensation nuclei. They also determine the supersaturation levels required for condensation in various organic compounds.
